Finding cliques and independent sets
The number of cliques and independent sets of a digraph - indeed, even the number of maximal ones - can be very large relative to the number of vertices, and so for even relatively small digraphs the computation of particular types of these sets can be very lengthy. The algorithms used to calculate cliques and independent sets make use of the of digraph to reduce the search space. Therefore the speed of computation may be improved if the of the digraph is as large as possible.
The algorithms used to calculate cliques and independent sets are based on the Bron-Kerbosch algorithm.
